page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
Our community is very dependent on the{Coal Mining Industry}for employment. For many generations past it was traditionally accepted that son would follow father into some sort of occupation with the NCB.
In recent years there has been a steady decline in mining operations, partly due to the exhaustion of coal seams and the closing down of pits that have become uneconomic. This decline has and will further be accelerated by the national NUM strike of 1984/85.
Rumours prevail in the community that Frickley Colliery may be in danger of closing in the near future. Many men of 55 years and less are being compulsory retired.
